sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Memoriale presbyterorum
Memoriale Presbyterorum
msDesc.p: Vellum, 309 185 12.2 x 7.4, ff. 96 + 6, double columns of 36 lines. Cent. xiv early, in a good large hand.
From Norwich Cathedral Priory: on f. 1r of text is the mark P. viij. in the proper form.

On ff. iv, iir are many verses (cent. xv). They are chiefly moral. The principal items are:
a. A prophecy:
Anno cephas mille canus catulus et cocadrille
Post binos quartos wlnera quinque sanis etc.

b. A collection of proverbs in metre:
Disce libens iuuenis puerilis dum sinit etas
Ut sub nube senis semina multa metas
Nnulla valet tantum virtus paciencia quantum
Ut rosa flos florum sic est paciencia morum
etc.
On f. iiv list of Tituli, ending f. ivv
The MS. is noticed by Tanner, s.v. Grosseteste, but not assigned to any author. However, under Hanneya (Th. de) he assigns it to that writer, citing MS. Bodl. NE. E. 1. 9, Mus. 91

msItem.rubric: Incipit memoriale presbiterorum parochialium a diuersis doctorum tractatibus sub breuitate extractum
msItem.incipit: Cum animaduerterem quamplurimos presbiteros parochiales grauiter errare in uia confessiones suorum subditorum audiendi
msItem.rubric: 1. Qualiter presbiter parochialis in audiendo confessionem alicuius se debet habere erga confitentem
msItem.incipit: In primis oportebit te confessorem considerate

ab.decoNote: This page has a very good initial of English work with gold ground, and a partial border ending in very pretty leaves

msItem.ab: The table divides the book into two parts, a of 97 and b of 98 chapters
msItem.explicit: in scriptis domini hostiensis et aliis uariis modernorum doctorum si ea diligenter uolueris intueri
msItem.ab: On the last fly-leaves are the beginning of a table and some scribbles and an entry of price viiid
Two forms of absolution and reconciliation are among the scribbles
